Successful Aug. 15 national meeting hailed 
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) -- The (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of (South) Korean Trade Unions, which had participated in the August 15 national meeting for reunification, in a joint statement on august 23 said that the success of the meeting, the first of its kind in Seoul since the national division, fully demonstrated once again the vitality of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, according to a news report.
 The statement said the meeting provided the whole world with a clear glimpse of the unity of the Korean nation willing to achieve independent and peaceful reunification at any cost, unyielding to the U.S. undisguised threat of war.    
 The meeting confirmed again the willingness of the south and north Korean workers to symphasize and cooperate with each other for the nations independent reunification it added.

Kim Jong Il returns home
Kim Jong Il inspects DPRK-Russia Friendship House
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il returns home 
    Pyongyang, August 25 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il returned home on August 24 after his successful visit to the far eastern region of the Russian Federation.
 He conducted energetic external activities, making a long journey covering more than 2,800 km. He had a historic meeting with Russian President V. V. Putin, thus further deepening the friendly relations and strengthening the ties of DPRK-Russia friendship. This recorded a new chapter in the history of bilateral relations.    
 Kim Jong Il's historic visit to the Far Eastern region marked another landmark event which provided a new turn in boosting the traditional DPRK-Russia friendship.
